basic.description: This course covers the computational methods for solving mathematical problems in finance; basic numerical methods, numerical solution of parabolic partial differential equations, including convergence and stability, solution of the Black-Scholes equation, boundary conditions for American options and binomial and random walk methods.
basic.subject: MAP
basic.title: Introduction to Computational Finance

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: MAP 5601; and C, C++ or appropriate computer language.
